intro: Draba atlantica var. battandieri, commonly known as the Atlantic rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the British Isles. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 5–15 centimeters. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from April to June. Its leaves are basal, rosette-like, and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. It thrives in rocky, calcareous soils and is often found on coastal cliffs and sea cliffs.
